description:
The Norman Fisher Observatory is owned and run by Croydon Astronomical Society. 
Open for the public to visit on clear Saturday evenings from September through to April, we will welcome visitors on Sunday 14th September between 2pm & 4pm.

events.name: Drop in: Observatory Open Day
events.notes: An open day at the Norman Fisher Observatory.

facilities: Handrails on one side of stairs

factsheet.heading: Astronomy.
paragraphs:
Welcome to the Observatory of the Croydon Astronomical Society.
Since 1979 we have welcomed visitors to the Observatory every clear Saturday night to view the night sky. A moderately dark sky, when at its best we can see the Milky Way.
Today we open in daylight so visitors can see a little more of the buildings and site and hear about our history and what we now do here.

images.title: Main dome of the Norman Fisher Observatory, with the clubhouse behind.

Photo by Paula Harvey:
Aurora Borealis over Norman Fisher Observatory, Friday 10th May 2024.

location.address: Waterhouse Lane, Off Hayes Lane, Kenley, CR8 5EP
travel_info: Additional travel info: No Car parking at the Observatory, please park in Hayes Lane.

name: Norman Fisher Observatory
